desk.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a piece of furniture like a table, usually with drawers in it, that you sit at to write and work
desk.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Marie was sitting at her desk.
desk.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a place where you can get information or use a particular service in a hotel, airport etc
desk.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: an office that deals with a particular subject, especially in newspapers or television
desk.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: How come your desk is always so tidy?
His desk is so cluttered he can't find anything.
There are one or two empty desks in the office.
The children are at their school desks by 8:30 in the morning.
I got back from holiday to find piles of papers on my office desk.
Under the window was a small writing desk.
He sat at a plain wooden desk.
I don't want to do a job in which I'm sitting at a desk all day.
He got up from his desk to welcome the visitors.
I need to tidy my desk.
It's a good idea to clear your desk regularly.
He left his desk job to become a gardener.
I think I left my car keys in the desk drawer.
Don't forget to switch off the desk lamp.
desk.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a piece of furniture like a table, usually with drawers in it, that you sit at to write and work
desk.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: My father has worked behind a desk for over forty-two years.
desk.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a place where you can get information in a hotel, airport etc
desk.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: You may enquire at the information desk about tour times for the King’s Palace.
